trustfund:
TF037350-TAJIKISTAN - EMERGENCY FLOOD ASSISTANCE,TF037290-TAJIKSTAN - EMERGENCY FLOOD
            ASSISTANCE PROJECT,TF036843-TAJIKISTAN - EMERGENCY FLOOD ASSISTANCE,TF036435-TAJIKISTAN - P-C RECONSTRUCTION
            (POST CONFLICT),TF034640-ECA REGION - PILOT RECONSTRUCTION

abstracts.cdata!:
The general outcome/achievement of the
            project is considered unsatisfactory. The project did not
            focus on the issue of sustainability, given the nature of
            the economic Recovery Credit. Overall, IDA performance is
            rated satisfactory. Even taking into account the resource
            constraints and circumstances prevailing in Tajikistan, the
            overall performance of the Borrower must be rated
            unsatisfactory. Projects such as this one have to be
            designed with a great built-in flexibility in order to be
            able to adequately address unforseeable needs as they evolve
            from the reconstruction process. Such operations are
            necessarily more resource intensive than traditional
            operations and resource allocations for supervision should
            be made accordingly on a case by case basis. Supervision
            arrangements should also be tailored to the specific
            circumstances of the project and provide for a substantially
            larger involvement of Country Office staff in day-to-day
            follow up and advisory support. the procurement arrangements
            adopted for the project provide another example highlighting
            the potential risks for conflict between IDA requirements
            and the need for operational flexibility. While rational
            from a policy point of view, the arrangements proved to be
            too complex and cumbersome for the limited management
            capacity of the project implementation unit (RPCU), and
            rather than preventing mismanagement, opened the door to it.
            IDA eventually agreed--too late--to revise the procurement arrangements.
